abstract: Congress authorizes Medal of Honor for Sgt Gary Rose for heroics performed in Laos in 1970, award previously denied Rose due to classified nature of operations there; Rose's award will be first Medal of Honor expressly acknowledging actions on ground in so-called Secret War in Laos.
lead_paragraph: Sgt. Gary Rose, a medic with an elite group of commandos in 1970, is to receive the first Medal of Honor acknowledging the heroics of a soldier on the ground in the Secret War in Laos.

headline.main: Secrets, Denial, and, Decades Later, a Medal of Honor for a Vietnam Medic
headline.print_headline: Delayed Medal Recognizes Secret War in Laos

snippet: Sgt. Gary Rose, a medic with an elite group of commandos in 1970, is to receive the first Medal of Honor acknowledging the heroics of a soldier on the ground in the Secret War in Laos....
